column1: '''''Arda Philology 3''''' is the third volume of the journal ''[[Arda (annual)
column2: Arda Philology]]'', and contains the proceedings of the Third International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages, ''[[Omentielva
column3: Omentielva Nelya]]'', which was held in Whitehaven in August [[2009]].

column1: * [[Helios De Rosario Martínez]]: "A Methodological Study of Elvish Writing Systems"
* [[Mick Ennis]]: "An Elvish Learning Curve: From Cambridge to Whitehaven, Telperion and the Stars..."
* [[Helge Fauskanger]]: "Exegesis of Tolkien's Linguistic Material: A Note on Challenges and Ambiguities"
* [[Valeria Barouch]]: "''Arvernien'', or, On the Winding of Rivers"
* [[Agnieszka Tańczuk]]: "The Language of Magic in J.R.R. Tolkien’s Works"
